unnormalised: CBSE class 10th and 12th results are expected to be announced by mid-May, according to sources. Students are eagerly waiting, checking the official website cbse.nic.in every hr. Some coaching centres r promising early results, but it’s best to stick to official announcements.
normalised: C-B-S-E class tenth and twelfth results are expected to be announced by mid-May, according to sources. Students are eagerly waiting, checking the official website c-b-s-e dot n-i-c dot i-n every hour. Some coaching centres are promising early results, but it’s best to stick to official announcements.

unnormalised: The board exams were conducted from 15/02/2024 to 13/03/2024. Evaluation process started immediately after. "Paper checking was strict this time," said Mrs. Sharma, a teacher at Delhi Public School. Many students found the Maths paper particularly tough, predicting lower than 80% scores.
normalised: The board exams were conducted from fifteenth february two thousand and twenty four to thirteenth march two thousand and twenty four. Evaluation process started immediately after. "Paper checking was strict this time," said Missus Sharma, a teacher at Delhi Public School. Many students found the Maths paper particularly tough, predicting lower than eighty percent scores.

unnormalised: Last year, the pass percentage for class 10 was 93.12% and for class 12 it was 87.33%. Everyone's hoping for similar or even better results this year. Remember, marks aren't everything! Focus on learning, not just scoring 90%+
normalised: Last year, the pass percentage for class ten was ninety three point one two percent and for class twelve it was eighty seven point three three percent. Everyone's hoping for similar or even better results this year. Remember, marks aren't everything! Focus on learning, not just scoring ninety plus percent

unnormalised: To check your results, you'll need your roll number, school number, and admit card ID. Keep them handy. The results will be available on multiple platforms including Digilocker and the CBSE results portal. SMS service also available.
normalised: To check your results, you'll need your roll number, school number, and admit card I-D. Keep them handy. The results will be available on multiple platforms including Digilocker and the C-B-S-E results portal. S-M-S service also available.

unnormalised: Good luck to all the students! Remember to celebrate your efforts, regardless of the outcome. Treat yourself with your fav snack, maybe samosas or jalebi??
normalised: Good luck to all the students! Remember to celebrate your efforts, regardless of the outcome. Treat yourself with your favorite snack, maybe samosas or jalebi?
